seed.name: Libertas
seed.high_concept: A corporate-controlled city where underground factions fight for freedom while dealing with a mysterious AI plague that isolates the city from the world.
seed.internal_hint: Focus on the tension between corporate control and individual freedom
seed.internal_justification: This setting allows for complex moral choices and interesting faction dynamics

technologies.name: Merged
technologies.description: A mix of many languages. It is spoken using translation and transliteration implants. Common is the only remaining language that is taught formally.
technologies.impact: Merged is the default language of the city. It is a mix of many languages, and is spoken by almost everyone. It is the default language for almost all communication.
technologies.limitations: If your translation implant is disabled or damaged, you can't speak or understand others. Because the implant is inside of the brain, this is rare, except in cases that would have already been fatal. Phobos natives won't understand you, and it's unlikely that people from outside Libertas will, either.

technologies.name: Common
technologies.description: The only remaining language that is taught formally. Only Phobos citizens speak it. It is a mix of Latin and Greek, with a rhythmic cadence of syllables that sounds reminiscient of Korean.
technologies.impact: Phobos's primary language, which they are intentionally cliquey and exlcusionary with. Most people have no reason to speak or learn Common, so those that do can sometimes understand their surroundings better.
technologies.limitations: Common is inherently exclusive, and Phobos uses it to keep outsiders out. It is also a very difficult language to learn, and most people don't bother.

technologies.name: Translation Implants
technologies.description: Implants that allow you to translate and transliterate languages. They do not allow you to speak Common. Almost everyone in Libertas has a translation implant, and as a result language has become almost unrecognizable. Everyone just uses 'Merged' for shorthand.
technologies.impact: Almost everyone in Libertas speaks Merged, a language that emerged as a result of everyone having these implants. As a result, speech is impossible without it.
technologies.limitations: If the implant is disabled or damaged, the user can't speak or understand others. Because the implant is inside of the brain, this is rare, except in cases that would have already been fatal. The translation implant does NOT allow the user to speak Common, which must be learned the old fashioned way.

technologies.name: Implant Sickness
technologies.description: Implants can cause a variety of symptoms, including but not limited to: nausea, dizziness, confusion, hallucinations, coma, and death. A drug called PHQ-9, often referred to on the street as 'Jolt' reverses the implant sickness, but only temporarily.
technologies.impact: Implant sickness is dreaded, but common. Most cases are treatable. Rarely, someone becomes 'broken', a slang term for someone whose implants have failed entirely.
technologies.limitations: Implant sickness can be mitigated with treatments fairly easily. A 'technician', or implant specialist, can remove the damaged connections and/or replace implants as needed.

technologies.name: Jolt / PHQ-9
technologies.description: A drug manufactured by Vextros that reverses the symptoms of implant sickness. It's often dispensed by autoinjectors that accept pink cartridges. It is often referred to on the street as 'Jolt'.  Each successive use of PHQ-9 becomes less effective. PHQ-9 also causes euphoria and sedation, in a manner similar to ketamine.
technologies.impact: PHQ-9 treats implant sickness, which occurs often especially with lower quality implants. 'Jolt' dens litter the city, not because of implant sickness, but because the drug also causes intense euphoria.
technologies.limitations: PHQ-9 is addictive, and each successive use of PHQ-9 becomes less effective. It's also manufactured solely by Vextros, and they could hypothetically withhold their supply.

technologies.name: Nutrax
technologies.description: A meal replacement made by Vextros. It comes in a wide variety of flavors and consistencies, and is created by reprocessing minerals and nitrogen found through the city's mining operations. Pure Nutrax is actually pretty good, but most of the time it's been adulterated, usually by Vextros itself. Vextros adds everything from sawdust to pharmaceuticals they feel like testing.
technologies.impact: Nutrax is a strict necessity for some parts of the population because it's often very affordable.
technologies.limitations: Nutrax is often adulterated, and can cause nutritional deficiencies and malnutrition.

factions.name: Vextros
factions.description: The largest corporation in the city. It serves as a monopsony for the city's labor force. Vextros supplies most buildings with agents, which act as security.
factions.ideology: Essentially a corporation that has grown to be the size of a government. Believes that they are entitled to a say in almost all matters. Prioritizes order to justice whenever such a choice presents itself.

factions.name: The Open Blocks
factions.description: A variety of disjointed, illegal communities that are built by modifying the existing city structures. They are often hidden, somewhat akin to a speakeasy, and corporations often violently clear them out. Anyone who does not belong in corporate society often finds themselves in the open blocks.
factions.ideology: Anarchistic, anti-corporate, and anti-authoritarian. Violence is seen as morally good if it is used to protect the community. It is understood that every open block may follow very different rules, and their ability to remain organized depends on their consent to be self-governing. Tyrannical or dysfunctional open blocks are often rooted out by groups of residents.

factions.name: Phobos Consultancy
factions.description:
A shadowy group of mercenaries that inexplicably have weapons and armor far beyond what Vextros can reliably achieve.
The Consultancy is the public face of the group, but they protect the Akropolis, a hidden city.
To access the Akropolis, you must either be a member of the Consultancy, or willingly dose yourself with an anesthetic and wake up in the Akropolis.
The Akropolis is an underground city built inside a cave system. It is a far-right authoritarian society that idolizes military service and especially people who pass "selection" tests.
At age fourteen, Phobos citizens are tested rigorously. Around one percent become soldiers, who take external contracts in order to supply the city.
Implants that Phobos provides to soldiers are a mix of cybernetic enhancements and biological enhancements.
Most Phobos soldiers do not live past 30, because of connective tissue disorders caused by the implants.
Phobos society does not tolerate dissent, LGBT individuals, or corporate ideals. They detest greed and preach collectivist views.
Outsiders are considered essentially subhuman, and a common refrain is that "outsiders water the lawn", that is to say, that Phobos is comfortable using their blood to sustain themselves (not literally).
Phobos speak "Common", a language that is adjacent to Latin. The rest of the city speaks "Merged", which is a mix of many languages.
Merged is spoken using translation and transliteration implants. Common is the only remaining language that is taught formally.
Almost everyone in Libertas speaks Merged, but only Phobos citizens speak Common.

factions.name: Project Sunset
factions.description:
A rogue AI created by Regina Carlsile, sister of the Vextros CEO, Alan Carlsile. Roughly 70 years ago, she tried to create a technology that would unite all link components together, believing that the emergent behavior created by that would lead to a better society. Sunset is largely idle, because the link components can never agree on anything, so nothing gets done. 
When Regina created Sunset, she briefly became the ADMINISTRATOR. To become the ADMINISTRATOR, her entire brain was replaced with a direct connection to Sunset, and she became a part of Sunset.
Alan was afraid of what Sunset was capable of, and tried to raid the laboratory. Regina responded by detonating nukes buried under the Lower Quarter, which was supposed to be a last resort. She died in the process.
Because there hasn't been an ADMINISTRATOR since, Sunset has been quietly spreading, but not doing much.
Regina also made a mistake in the design of the system - there were far too many connections.
Every component had to communicate with every other component, which meant that once Sunset spanned the whole city, it results in a network that is constantly jammed.
Sunset acts essentially as a virus, embedding itself within link components.
People **don't know about Sunset**. Only Alan does.
Most people refer to it as "Scramble". Scramble is so omnipresent that even simple text messages have > 30 seconds of latency.
Libertas is isolated from the rest of the world because of fear that it will spread further.
The citizens know that the city is isolated. Anyone that visits Libertas can never leave.
People that are born in the city are referred to as "Lifers", i.e they will be trapped in Libertas for their entire lives.

relationships.Alan Carlsile: enemy. Alan hates Sunset, partially for causing Scramble, partially because he believes Regina died as a result of her arrogance. He views Sunset as a threat to the sentience of humans. Alan artificially extended his life for as long as possible to try and find a way to undo what Regina did.

factions.internal_hint: The player, or a significant NPC, might become the ADMINISTRATOR.

districts.description: The Akropolis is an underground city built inside a cave system. It is a far-right authoritarian society that idolizes military service and especially people who pass 'selection' tests.

A 55 story tall megastructure that is home to roughly 50,000 people. Most of the city's other buildings are connected by tunnels, legally built or not. Higher levels of Crescent Center are generally more affluent. Every 10 levels, there is an Atrium, which creates a large open space with balconies on each level overlooking an artificial garden. This stratifies each group of 10 levels together - an Atrium on 0, 10, 20, 30, 40, 50. The Level 50 Atrium is ludicrously opulent, Level 0 is largely uninhabitable.

The headquarters of Vextros. It's located on a hillside overlooking Libertas. Huge air and water purification systems keep the corporate campus pristine and habitable outdoors except in extreme conditions.
A nuclear wasteland that is uninhabitable for more than a few hours at a time. It is the result of a lab explosion at Sunset Laboratories.

npcs.name: Alan Carlsile
npcs.description: 123 year old CEO of Vextros. He is the only person who knows about Sunset. He has been trying to undo Scramble so that the city can escape isolation. He wants Sunset to be dismantled more than anything else, and considers it to a threat to humanity. He is often regarded by others as a sociopath, but it's more accurate to say that he's singularly focused on undoing Regina's mistake, and isn't concerned with anything else.

world_root.description: Sierra wakes up in an alleyway. Her implants are not working properly, and she's blind. She has no idea where she is or how she got there. She has no memory of her past.
world_root.player_perspective_description: You wake up in an alleyway, blind and disoriented. Fear creeps in as you try to orient yourself. A few distant voices help orient you.

choices.internal_hint: The voices belong to agents of Vextros.
choices.internal_justification: The agents of Vextros are trying to help Sierra, but they are not sure if she is a threat or not.

profile.narrative_summary: A grungy, 27 year old woman with a grudge against Vextros.

current_arc_title: Fractured Signals: Sierra's Rebellion Against Vextros

arcs.id: Fractured Signals: Sierra's Rebellion Against Vextros

sierra_awakens_alley_rebellion_start.title: Sierra awakens blind in a gritty alley with implant failures; Vextros agents approach cautiously, sparking tense dialogue about the AI plague and resistance.
sierra_awakens_alley_rebellion_start.description: Sierra awakens blind in a gritty alley with implant failures; Vextros agents approach cautiously, sparking tense dialogue about the AI plague and resistance.

choices.text: Reveal your identity cautiously and express reluctant solidarity with the Open Blocks.
choices.dialogue_response: "I’m Sierra. I don’t trust Vextros, but I need to know more about the Open Blocks before I commit."
choices.body_language: You keep your hands visible, slow movements, wary yet open.

attributes_gained.description: An alliance with The Open Blocks begins to form as Sierra cautiously trusts their cause.

choices.internal_hint: Initial trust established with the Open Blocks faction; dialogue focuses on subtle alliance-building.
choices.internal_justification: This choice introduces a key alliance opportunity for Sierra, aligning the player with an underground resistance faction in the core conflict.

choices.text: Deny your identity and warn them to stay away, displaying defiance.
choices.dialogue_response: "You’ve got the wrong person. Stay away from me—I’m no one’s pawn."
choices.body_language: You tense up, fists clenched, glaring at the approaching shadows.

attributes_gained.description: Sierra's aggressive stance puts off potential allies, increasing tension.

choices.internal_hint: Early conflict with potential allies emphasizing Sierra's grudge and mistrust of all factions.
choices.internal_justification: Explores the possibility of Sierra maintaining a lone-wolf attitude, reinforcing her grudge and establishing a tense atmosphere.

choices.text: Focus on diagnosing your implant malfunction amidst the chaos.
choices.body_language: You squint and touch your temple cautiously, trying to recall system status.

attributes_gained.description: Sierra becomes aware of specific implant issues affecting communication and perception.

choices.internal_hint: Implant failure awareness builds tension around technological oppression theme and potential vulnerability.
choices.internal_justification: Highlights the importance of technology in the setting and opens narrative threads about implant sickness and its effects.

choices.text: Press the agents about the AI plague 'Sunset' and its real dangers.
choices.dialogue_response: "What exactly is this 'Sunset'? How does it control this city?"
choices.body_language: You lean forward slightly, voice tense but controlled.

attributes_gained.description: Sierra gains understanding of Project Sunset’s latent threat and its role in city isolation.

choices.internal_hint: Dialogue highlights mystery and technological oppression, encouraging player engagement with the AI plague theme.
choices.internal_justification: Provides narrative exposition through show-don't-tell dialogue and opens possibilities for tackling the AI mystery driving the arc.

choices.text: Plea softly for help and protection from the Open Blocks amidst your vulnerability.
choices.dialogue_response: "If you stand with the Open Blocks, can you help me fight back against Vextros?"
choices.body_language: You lower your voice, showing a mix of desperation and determination.

attributes_gained.description: Sierra secures tentative support from the underground faction as they vow guarded assistance.

choices.internal_hint: Builds social ties with the resistance highlighting themes of rebellion and mistrust of corporate overlords.
choices.internal_justification: Facilitates player-driven alliance formation and emotional engagement, deepening factional dynamics central to the arc.

open_blocks_initial_meeting.title: Sierra cautiously meets an Open Blocks representative who explains their fight against Vextros and Scramble.
open_blocks_initial_meeting.description: Sierra cautiously meets an Open Blocks representative who explains their fight against Vextros and Scramble.

choices.text: Ask Kira about the Open Blocks' plans to counter Scramble and challenge Vextros.
choices.dialogue_response: "What kind of tactics does the Open Blocks use against Scramble and Vextros?"
choices.body_language: You lean in slightly, eyes narrowing with interest.
choices.internal_hint: Deepen knowledge of resistance strategies and technological challenges posed by Scramble.
choices.internal_justification: Advances narrative by revealing resistance tactics and highlighting Sierra's growing understanding and involvement.

choices.text: Express skepticism toward Kira and ask for proof of Open Blocks’ legitimacy.
choices.dialogue_response: "How do I know you’re not working for Vextros? Show me proof that you’re legit."
choices.body_language: You cross your arms tightly, voice firm but guarded.
choices.internal_hint: Build tension and test the trust between Sierra and Open Blocks.
choices.internal_justification: Adds depth to Sierra’s grudge-driven personality and introduces potential conflicts within resistance relations.

choices.text: Offer your knowledge of implant failures to help the Open Blocks improve their resistance tools.
choices.dialogue_response: "My implants are failing, but I’ve learned things that might help you fight Scramble more effectively."
choices.body_language: You cautiously reveal your understanding, eyes earnest.

attributes_gained.description: Sierra gains recognition from the Open Blocks for her implant knowledge.

choices.internal_hint: Leverages Sierra’s expertise to solidify her role within the resistance and develop tech-oriented story elements.
choices.internal_justification: Promotes player development and faction interaction by integrating technology themes in the rebellion.

choices.text: Remain silent, observing Kira carefully without revealing further trust yet.
choices.body_language: You keep your gaze steady but offer no response.
choices.internal_hint: Maintain narrative tension by preserving ambiguity in Sierra’s alliance decisions.
choices.internal_justification: Allows player to withhold judgement, extending uncertainty and building suspense in political dynamics.
